Max Rockatansky.Action: Turns and smiles while in police uniform, showing a moment of connection and approachability.
Plays and laughs with Jessie and their child, showing affection and familial warmth.
Runs toward the bodies of Jessie and their child after they are attacked, demonstrating concern and urgency.
Fueling a fire with remnants of his past life (toys, photo albums, police badge), symbolizing emotional detachment or severing ties.
Becomes a shell of a man, burnt out and desolate, running from his past demons, indicating withdrawal and emotional numbness.
Turns and smiles confidently in police uniform amidst chaos.
Runs towards bodies of Jessie and child after they are attacked.
Fuels fire with personal belongings including police badge, showing symbolic refusal to move on.
Becomes a shell of a man, wild-eyed, burnt out and desolate, running from past demons.
Carefully scans the environment while driving, quickly stops the car upon sensing danger, alert to hostile individuals nearby.
Allows a mongrel dog to ride in a baby's auto seat, showing some attachment and care in a harsh environment.
Appears gaunt and unkempt, suggesting deterioration in physical condition possibly affecting capability.
Swerves and slaloms skillfully through a tangle of wrecked vehicles on the road, maintaining control and accelerating through a sweeping curve.
Successfully outruns multiple pursuers including skilled drivers navigating dangerous terrain.
Shows protective behavior toward the dog by allowing it to crawl under his seat for safety.
Focuses solely on combat and escape maneuvers without engaging or communicating with others.
Engages aggressively in violent car combat to survive and pursue his goals.
Hurries to the wreck to check the injured driver and tries to collect fuel by mopping up the gas leaking on the road.
Examines the wrecked road rig and assesses the situation calmly and practically without expressed emotion.
Turns quickly toward the anguished scream and the dying driver's hand emerging from the wreckage, showing responsiveness to suffering.
Executes a sharp handbrake U-turn and stops confidently in the middle of the intersection.
Quickly assesses a dangerous scene, uses a jerry can and bandana resourcefully to mop up spilled gasoline to prevent further hazard.
Carefully examines wreckage and road rig to evaluate damage and resource status (noting empty fuel tank and punctured tires).
Shows focus and alertness when responding to whistling and scanning his surroundings despite danger signals (Wez's threat).
Picks up a toy hurdy-gurdy from the dead man's hand and plays the first few notes of 'Happy Birthday'.
Throws a fragment of a smashed road sign into the air, then drives off undecidedly.
Leaves dog to guard the car and cautiously approaches an abandoned gyrocopter, looking carefully for traps.
Catches a snake poised to strike but stops when instructed to not hurt it, carefully laying it down instead.
Warns the Gyro Captain about the car being booby-trapped to prevent harm.
Notices the gas tank is empty, reacts immediately to the hiss, freezes and carefully catches a striking snake by the neck.
Warns the Gyro Captain about the booby-trapped car fuel tanks, preventing harm.
Calmly and carefully disarms by throwing down the tyre iron and unhitches a shotgun, showing tactical awareness.
Shows quick reflexes and resourcefulness in disarming traps and handling threats to protect himself and others.
Subdues the Gyro Captain with a shotgun but eases off the trigger when offered valuable information.
Uses mechanical skill to locate and disable booby-trap devices under the car.
Remains calm and aware when threatened at gunpoint, anticipates and neutralizes threat by releasing his dog to attack.
Quickly overpowers adversary and gains control of weapon.
Keeps his head and listens for valuable information about fuel location, showing practical intelligence.
Rams the Gyro Captain's head to force information; uses the dog as a method of control and intimidation.
Smiles to himself at the dog's reaction, showing a moment of humor or lightness.
Observes the battle attentively using binoculars, showing concern for the defenders and the compound's safety.
Uses binoculars to carefully observe the battle and assess enemy movements from a safe distance.
Recognizes enemy members and their vehicles, showing situational awareness and experience.
Keeps his bargain with the Gyro Captain by not killing him despite chaining him up.
Chains the Gyro Captain to a tree stump, showing distrust and restraint in dealings.
Drops binoculars then quickly chains Gyro Captain to a tree stump, enforcing a deal firmly and confidently.
Tests the chain after securing the Gyro Captain, indicating thoroughness and caution.
Shares dog food with the DOG, tossing the empty can to it after eating.
Leans forward to watch carefully through binoculars while eating, showing focus and alertness over social engagement.
Uses binoculars with a tripod made from sticks for surveillance, demonstrating resourcefulness and careful observation.
Eats while maintaining vigilance, spooning food into his mouth and then watching through binoculars.
Tosses the empty food can to the dog, indicating efficient use of available resources and attention to companions.
Grabs the Gyro Captain's telescope to get a better view of the situation despite the Captain's protests.
Closes his eyes momentarily at the sight of the woman being assaulted, showing internal distress.
Drops the telescope and runs down to his vehicle immediately upon realizing the danger to the woman, indicating intent to intervene or escape quickly.
Avoids direct confrontation with aggressors (no indication he directly rescues or protects the woman in this excerpt).
Cuts the Mohawker's crossbow bolts to free Nathan despite stating he needs fuel.
Shakes Nathan encouragingly to keep him alive despite Max’s practical need.
Pins down the Mohawker's wrist and swiftly disables him with bolt cutters, demonstrating quick reflexes and tactical skill.
Cuts arrows from the panel to free Nathan, showing problem-solving skills and practical knowledge under pressure.
Urgently urges Nathan to stay alive while shaking him, showing situational awareness and leadership in a critical moment.
Carries an injured man (Nathan) across his shoulders into the compound without weapons raised, signaling peaceful intent.
Raises his arms high and steps out unarmed, indicating trust and non-aggression toward the compound defenders.
Allows the feral kid to follow him without hostility or dismissal.
Approaches the compound unarmed while carrying an injured man, raising his arms to show he is not a threat, demonstrating confidence and calculated risk-taking.
Despite being unarmed, successfully gains entry into a hostile compound, showing skill and situational awareness.
Walks on past distressed people without engaging emotionally.
Finds an injured man two to three miles away, left for dead, and makes a deal with him.
Brought a man in trouble to the community seeking help and insisted on getting his due (gas).
Directly tells Quiet Man that the woman in the car is dead, without softening the truth.
Keeps his temper when confronted and tries to remind others of the contract fairly.
Keeps his temper in a stressful situation while negotiating for his promised gas despite distrust and hostility from the crowd.
States clearly and simply that the woman in the car is dead, showing straightforward communication under pressure.
Insists on the contract and tries to hold others to their word, demonstrating confidence and a clear mindset.
Does not try to explain or justify himself further when faced with Pappagallo’s rejection, potentially missing an opportunity to persuade.
Grabs the mechanic's assistant arm to stop him from battering the dog to death.
Slowly bends and gathers up the dog after being threatened with crossbow.
Recognizes enemy Wez without immediate aggression, holding a measured presence.
Recognizes enemy leader Wez across no man's land and maintains composure during tense standoff.
Allows a tense negotiation/dialogue instead of immediate violence, indicating strategic judgment.
Is impressed by the Feral Kid's skill and bravery in throwing the boomerang.
Max is impressed by the Feral Kid's skill with the boomerang, showing his recognition of skill and judgment.
Max remains silent and does not directly intervene during the Marauders' antics and violence, such as Wez attacking the Defiant Victim.
Concentrates on his manacles and starts to use a small file to pick the lock.
Plays the hurdy-gurdy, attempts to lighten the mood by playing 'Happy Birthday' and making the Feral Boy laugh.
Sits forgotten while others argue, does not intervene or engage in the crowd's conflict.
Plays the hurdy-gurdy to cleverly demonstrate that his manacles are unlocked and that he is free, using indirect communication to influence others without confrontation.
Remains largely silent and detached during a critical discussion among the camp people, not directly engaging or leading, possibly missing an opportunity to guide or influence the group.
Advocates for defending the fuel as the group's lifeline despite protests, expressing determination to stay and protect it alone if necessary.
Engages openly with the divided group, speaking directly and encouraging others to talk to him to find a way out.
Standing firm to defend the fuel, declares he will stay alone if he must, showing resolve and leadership under pressure.
Offers practical information about a vehicle capable of hauling the tanker, indicating knowledge and capability critical to survival and escape.
Commands attention and invites others to talk to him about escaping, demonstrating confidence and initiative.
Makes a clear, pragmatic offer to trade the prime mover for his black car and fuel, showing negotiation skill and understanding of his needs.
Carries multiple heavy jerry cans across a dangerous bridge at night while wearing a knee brace, demonstrating physical capability and determination despite impairment.
Uses oil on the metal bridge to reduce noise, indicating tactical thinking and preparation for stealth.
Moves silently toward the Marauders’ campfires at night, exhibiting caution and skill in hostile terrain.
Allows the Feral Kid to save him from the Gayboy Berserker by following his lead without hesitation.
Does not retaliate or escalate confrontation with the Gayboy Berserker after falling, and calmly follows the Feral Kid away from danger.
Keeping gun trained on the Captain while calmly rummaging through the marauder's clothes to find useful items.
Tricks the Gyro Captain by loading a cartridge into the shotgun but it is actually empty.
Allows the Gyro Captain to live and leave despite the deception.

Realizes the shotgun barrels are empty and uses an intact shotgun cartridge to convincingly bluff the GYRO CAPTAIN by inserting it into the barrel and snapping the gun shut, creating a threatening and strategic advantage.
Calmly forces the GYRO CAPTAIN to comply by leveraging the bluff, showing confidence and control in a high-pressure situation.
Works on the engine of the prime mover, diagnosing and repairing it sufficiently to get it started after repeated attempts.
Tosses the Gyro Captain a set of keys, gives him a choice to follow or fly a kite.
Tosses keys to Gyro Captain and decisively drives off alone, indicating trust but clear prioritization of his own plan.
Checks his shotgun before approaching the enemy camp, showing preparation and readiness.
Accelerates the prime mover aggressively toward the enemy camp, demonstrating confidence and skillful control of the vehicle.
Shunts a road racer off the road and into the tow truck, causing it to crush an enemy
Yanks the air horn lanyard upon cresting the rise to alert his allies
Grabs a shotgun and attempts to stop the enemy despite the cartridge being a dud, fights aggressively to protect and survive.
Engages in violent combat with WEZ and the marauders with no indication of hesitation or empathy.
Smashes the butt of the shotgun into Wez's face repeatedly to subdue him.
Jumps out of the prime mover assessing the situation immediately upon arrival inside the compound.
Picks up Pappagallo's flame thrower, climbs the battlements, sprays fire at marauders causing them to retreat.
Does not verbally acknowledge Warrior Woman's compliment for bravery, silently hands her the flamethrower and walks away.
Hesitates, then shakes the Feral Kid's hand briefly.
Allows the Feral Kid to follow him and mimic his gait without discouragement.
Continues working quietly without overtly engaging when Pappagallo asks him to join and thanks are implied.
Hesitates before shaking hands with the Feral Kid, showing some social reluctance but still attempts connection.
Skillfully re-arms booby traps by connecting wires and fuses to gas tank caps, demonstrating technical proficiency and tactical preparation.
Focuses on his work despite being confronted by Pappagallo about driving the tanker, showing calm composure and prioritization.
Removes utility belt and jacket to work more effectively on the machinery, showing practical awareness and adaptability.
Snaps at the Feral Kid by abruptly grabbing his wrist and stopping him from taking the hurdy-gurdy, then releases him
Refuses Pappagallo's offer to rebuild life and rejects involvement, emphasizing self-preservation and distrust
Maintains distance and avoids emotional connection by shutting down hope in favor of survival
Continues working silently despite seeing men nailed to poles and suffering around him, ignoring provocations and fear in camp.
Keeps working on the prime mover despite the threatening display of the Marauders and camp members' fearful reactions.
Ignores a mechanic's insult and focuses on preparing the vehicle, showing emotional control and focus under pressure.
Builds the ramp quietly and diligently without seeking praise or recognition.
Ignores the Gyro Captain's encouragement and invitation to stay and drive the tanker.
Puts out his hand and shakes hands with the Captain despite being curt.
Wishes the Captain good luck sincerely before leaving.
Takes cautious defensive action with his shotgun when something lands on the car roof.
Tells the Feral Kid to get out and go back, showing impatience and intolerance.
Tells the Feral Kid he can't come along and warns him not to get close to people because it can hurt him.
Gives the Feral Kid the hurdy-gurdy before pushing him out of the car.
Decides to send the Feral Kid away for his own safety despite emotional difficulty, demonstrating awareness and caution.
Hands the Feral Kid the hurdy-gurdy before pushing him out of the car, showing forethought in providing a keepsake or tool.
Hits the supercharger switch and pushes the black-on-black vehicle to its limits during a high-speed chase.
Is bewildered by the Humungus machine's massive acceleration using nitrous oxide.
The DOG licks and paws at Max's face, showing loyalty and companionship.
Max watches grim-faced as the DOG falls dead protecting him.
Max defends himself while hiding, showing survival instinct but limited friendly interaction.
Uses a booby trap effectively to eliminate multiple enemies at once.
Despite severe injuries, drags himself forward toward the compound, showing persistence and survival skill.
His mental state becomes feverish and disoriented under extreme pain and heat.
Volunteers to drive the tanker despite injury and risk
Acknowledges he is the best option for the dangerous task
Passes the feral kid safely down from the Warrior Woman to the ground, enabling his escape.
Focuses on revving the tanker engine and making a breakout despite danger, prioritizing escape over direct confrontation.
Checks out the controls of the tanker, familiarising himself with the machine.
Kicks over the big engine and revs it higher and higher, demonstrating mechanical and driving skills.
Passes the Feral Kid down from Warrior Woman safely to the ground, showing situational awareness and responsibility.
Engages the engine and drives the tanker forward at speed through the compound with Marauders in pursuit, showing bravery and skilled vehicle handling.
Steers the tanker towards a burning road racer, crashing through enemy lines despite gunfire, showing control and determination.
Struggles with the wheel, managing to keep the vehicle on the road despite being attacked and forced off balance.
Has no choice but to surrender to external forces (cow catcher shunting his vehicle) momentarily losing control.
Watches helplessly as Warrior Woman is shot and struggles in the wire, showing concern for her despite inability to act.
Looks in the passenger-side mirror to monitor the approaching threat posed by Wez's tow truck and attackers.
Watches helplessly as Warrior Woman is shot and falls into barbed wire without apparently intervening.
Yells a warning as the Mechanic is shot, clearly concerned for others' safety.
Attacks the Road Racer firing on the Mechanic and Warrior Woman with shotgun blasts to protect them.
Focuses on aggressive retaliation and physical confrontation without evident communication or reassurance to others.
Yells as he sees the driver fire another arrow into the Mechanic.
Tears off the sling which supports his wrist, grabs the shotgun, pumps both barrels into the road racer, shatters the windscreen and blows off the bonnet.
Hauls down hard on the wheel causing the tanker to swerve into the road racer, rolling it and tumbling it into another vehicle.
Looks back under siege, signals for the crossbow, demonstrating awareness and quick communication despite being under attack.
Waits after raising shotgun and does not immediately shoot the ducking GAYBOY BERSERKER.
Fires point-blank at SIDE CAR RIDER and SMEGMA CRAZY, killing them without hesitation.
Attempts to rescue the Feral Kid by reaching out to grab him while struggling with injury.
Defends himself aggressively against the Gayboy Berserker, focusing on survival but showing some care through protective actions.
Struggles to free himself from bear claws and reload his gun under extreme pressure.
Uses the rear view mirror as an improvised weapon to fend off an attacker.
Tries to reach out to the Feral Kid despite being physically trapped and injured.
Grabs the Feral Kid to bring him into the tanker, protects him during the attack.
Encourages and helps the Feral Kid load and handle a gun despite the Kid's inexperience.
Shoots the attacking Berserker to protect himself and the Kid.
Rams the barrel into the Bear Claw Biker's armpit and fires, enduring injury.
Shouts at the Feral Kid to get back to keep him safe, trying to prevent him from danger.
Fails to physically stop the Feral Kid from climbing onto the tanker despite danger, showing some hesitation or inability.
Struggles to control the tanker as tyres are blown out, maintains composure despite difficult situation.
Commands the Kid to get back, aware of danger to others, attempts to manage team safety.
Is unable to prevent the Kid from climbing on the tanker despite clear danger, moment of lack of control over situation.
Hesitates to jump from the tanker, looks for the Kid despite danger.
Leaps from the tanker despite being grabbed, fights to escape injury.
Fights to bring the crippled tanker under control despite difficult circumstances, wrestling with the wheel and navigating the damaged vehicle.
Hesitates when urged to jump off the tanker, showing momentary indecision.
Leaps off the tanker under duress, managing to find a foothold on the Lone Wolf machine despite injury (arm embedded in his shoulder), demonstrating physical skill and presence of mind.
Yells asking about the Kid's safety, shows concern.
Throws Pappagallo out of the vehicle after learning he left the boy behind.
Cuts engine to stop vehicle and take control, prioritizing immediate action.
Makes his way over the back engine of the speeding vehicle and tears the bear claw arm out of Pappagallo's shoulder, then eases himself down into the cockpit and takes control of the vehicle.
Cuts the engine of the vehicle deliberately to stop it after confirming the situation with Pappagallo.
Confronts Pappagallo about leaving the Kid behind, showing awareness and concern for the situation.
Throws Pappagallo out of the vehicle and takes the driver’s seat, decisively assuming control of the situation.
Max takes control of his vehicle under pressure, intentionally spins to avoid collision, uses the car to knock a pursuer off the road, and skillfully pursues the enemy.
Fires crossbow at the Humungus machine in pursuit, showing readiness to fight without hesitation.
Carefully approaches hostile vehicle after chase, showing caution but no evident aggression beyond necessary self-defense.
Raises the Bear Claw arm and fires the crossbow while closing in on Wez's vehicle despite limited time to aim.
Slows the vehicle cautiously and draws alongside Wez's car in the wasteland, demonstrating careful pursuit.
